metadata.title: CVE-2019-5739 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: Keep-alive HTTP and HTTPS connections can remain open and inactive for upto 2 minutes in Node.js 6.16.0 and earlier. Node.js 8.0.0 introduced adedicated server.keepAliveTimeout which defaults to 5 seconds. The behaviorin Node.js 6.16.0 and earlier is a potential Denial of Service (DoS) attackvector. Node.js 6.17.0 introduces server.keepAliveTimeout and the 5-seconddefault.

criterions.comment: nodejs: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
